title: What is the common law that governs all things in the universe according to this text?
first_phrase: This text contemplates the unity of the universe, where minerals, plants, and beasts are all reproductions of the same law. This law is constantly present in all phases of the universe through its threefold manifestation of matter and the humanized trinity. The text explains the foundation of this consciousness, the analogy, and how it's the common law that regulates the similarity in different forms and expressions of things. The last 200 tokens go on to explore how a single analogical law joins together the sun, man, fly, elephant, rose, wave of the sea, and dream life, expressing birth and death through the rising and setting of the sun.

Una stessa legge si esprime con una nascita ed una morte. "Oriri" in latino e' nascere, "moriri" in latino e' la identica parola che esprime la nascenza preceduta dalla m che e' la lettera M indicante la doppia ricorrenza della vita vissuta; L'oriente e l'occaso sono i due termini estremi della vita e della morte del sole, come la nascita e la morte dell'uomo, nella mosca, nell'elefante, nella rosa, come il principio e la fine nell'onda del mare e nella vita del sogno.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the universe is governed by one single law of light and shadow, birth and death, rise and fall. This law extends across all living beings, including the sun, man, animals, and the ocean. Love is the key that unlocks the understanding of this law and fosters a sense of connection with the universe, as represented by the symbol of the heart pierced by an arrow. Without this feeling of interconnectedness, man cannot love or comprehend the mysteries of his existence, which have been studied by ancient schools of thought, such as Kabbalah and Pythagoreanism, but ultimately, love remains the universal answer.
